name: Le Moulin des Templiers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights and wished it were more. After visiting crowded Paris, this was the most relaxing place you could dream of. We had dinner there both nights and the food was superb. Sitting by the river for breakfast, dinner and afternoon drinks was to die for. The bed was king size and very comfortable. It's only a short drive to Vezelay, Avallon, or just about any town in Bergundy. I cannot recommend it highly enough.
reviews.title: Just a wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Le Moulin des Templiers was a fantastic B&B! It is located 10 minutes from Vezelay in a lovely town called Portaubert, and the surroundings are gorgeous as the property is right by a small river! Our room was simple, tastefully decorated, quiet, and very very clean!, We had a really good nights sleep as the bed was so comfortable. Aimee was a wonderful, and I mean wonderful host! She was so sweet and made us feel right at home! We chose to eat dinner in the private dining room for guests. The dinner cost is over and above the room charge, and was reasonable and well worth it! The dining room had a rustic charm! We can't say enough about the dinner that was served; it was one of the BEST meals we had in France and we ate all over France! Aimee and her husband should be chef's! My husband went on and on about the Creme Brulee and said it was the best he ever had! It was such a nice experience staying at Le Moulin des Templiers! We LOVED it and want to visit again!
reviews.title: Wow! GREAT B&B by Vezelay! Loved it!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ( 2 couples) arrived late after 9pm, in the pouring rain after a long motorcycle journey from Calais. Aimee waited up for us to arrive and made us very welcome, gave us time to dry off and then served us a lovely home cooked 4 course meal with beer and wine after normal service had finished at 8pm. This was way beyond what we had expected. This was much appreciated.
reviews.title: Family run business providing extra care, service and quality food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The building is an old mill by a little river in a sleepy hollow, full of charm and history. A great little hide away. Dont expect five star luxury accommodation, but five star friendly servive and well worth a visit. Will go again one day if possible.
reviews.title: Lovely place and great food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights here and the location is wonderful. The rooms are tiny and very basic, as are the bathrooms. The hosts though a french couple are charming and helpful. The evening dinner is the best of french home country cooking and a delightful expereince.
reviews.title: Yummy dinner, great location, ok room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We found Le Moulin des Templiers to be everything we had hoped for and more. The location on the Cousins river is beautiful, the inn is charming and the dinner was delicious. The dinner was so good that we tried to replicate it as soon as we returned home.
reviews.title: Charming!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent one memorable night at the Moulins and after a frantic but totally awesome week in Paris the sudden serenity and peacefullness of this place was a welcome relief. I can't really add anything more to comment about other than to agree with all the comments made by other travellers. Dinner at the Moulins as prepared and served by the hosts is an absolute must and for the rooms do not expect the Ritz. They are pretty rustic. In one of the two rooms we had, the entire bathroom was set inside an antique Provincial French Armoire!
reviews.title: Place oozes charm and hosts make you feel like family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A gorgeous place, with such friendly and welcoming hosts - found almost by chance on our way back from a Wedding in the South. We spent two nights here which gave us a day to appreciate the stunning countryside and take in Vezelay and Bazoche - both unforgettable. As others have said, the bedrooms are small, but full of ambience, and everything has been thought of. The highlight for us was - apart from the beautiful river, and owls hooting at night, the exceptional dinner cooked and presented by our hosts.... the best food we'd had in our whole stay. Next time I hope it will be warm enough to eat outside - that must be magical.
reviews.title: Peaceful, beautiful, delicious - Rural France at its best...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family of 4 stayed here for one night. I must say the room was very small for all of us but it was fine for our short visit. The room was very basic but the beautiful surroundings and charming, historic breakfast room more than made up for that shortcoming. The owner served us breakfast and was very pleasant. I would have liked to stay for a few hours to enjoy the natural beauty of the locale but unfortunately didn't have time.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, charming inn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just came from a lovely stay at Moulin de Templiers. We were the only guests there and Aimee and her husband were very nice hosts. Make sure you have the dinner - it was a hearty three course "country" meal...delicious! Probably the best creme brulee I've tasted. The mill itself is very simple and the rooms aren't anything too special but it was a very charming stay for just a couple nights.
reviews.title: lovely stay in the French countryside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Although the rooms are old and tiny (this is after all a very old mill), this place is loaded with charm. We stayed in late October, but I can imagine how beautiful & pleasant it would be in the summer. Breakfast was served in the rustic & charming old millhouse by the fireplace. The Cousin River and millpond are right next to the hotel. The staff was very helpful and speak passable English. Probably the nicest grounds of any place we stayed in France. The Le Gourmillon restaurant was recommended by our hosts, which was a 5 minute drive into Avallon-a small family run place that was superb.
reviews.title: Rustic & Charming Old Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was an amazing place to stay. The hosts were extremely welcoming, the rooms, although small were quaint, clean and fit the atmosphere of the converted mill. Sipping Chablis by the river, what was even more brilliant was the food. The husband owner/chef cooked up miracle after miracle for our 4 nights stay (entree, main, dessert and a fabulous wine list). We are vegan and given notice, the chef cooked up some beautiful vegetarian dishes (from veggies fresh from the market each day). Just a short walk along the river to Avalon too! Also very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Amazing hosts, food, wine and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at this small country hotel several times since 1985. The location on the charming Cousin "river" is verdant and peaceful. The buildings are of historic significance and while the rooms are very small by current standards they are charming and clean and to change them would change the ambiance. The current owners offer dinner to guests and it is an excellent value. We love to stay here at the beginning of our vacation in France to recover from jet-lag and drink in the peaceful sounds of the river. Those not familiar with the French system of rating hotels (with stars) should understand that the number of stars often relates to the size of the room and not the ambiance. Just leave those big suitcases locked in the car and take in an overnight bag. Also, there is one small "suite" that can be rented that has a sitting room if you want to bring all the bags in with you. The owners are warm and welcoming and you'll find beauty and calm in this lovely area of Burgandy.
reviews.title: A peaceful escape to an unspoiled corner of rural France

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very quiet and simple rooms in great location by the cousin river. limited dinner possibilities but nice breakfast. Very clean and neat and pleasant owners. Easy to go to Avallon for dinner if you want more choices than the offered table d'hote.
reviews.title: nice stay in simple hotel - great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, this part of Burgundy is simply gorgeous, filled with rolling countryside, picture perfect villages, castles, churches, rivers, and forests. There's enough to keep lovers of rural France happy for days. It's just minutes from the large, historic town of Avallon, but you might as well be in the middle of nowhere.
reviews.title: A rustic dream!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Moulin on Sunday May 20, and found the situation just as charming as everyone else, but the rooms are extremely basic, a little pokey and quite dark. We found the staff lovely and the valley of the Cousin like a series of Corot paintings - exquisitely green.
reviews.title: Remember what Two Stars Means

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But we left after one night, finding the room stuffy, the towels skimpy and the breakfast just adequate.
reviews.title: Restfull Inn full of character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: The guests seemed to be almost exclusively North American - yet in every other hotel we stayed, foreigners were a tiny minority. I suspect that the Trip Advisor reviews have helped fuel this.
reviews.title: A terrific place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: French guests know what 2 stars mean - and adjust accordingly.
reviews.title: Rustic and romantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2002
reviews.text: If you want to see what is possible at exactly the same price within ten miles, try Les Deux Ponts at Pierre Pierthuis, just south of St. Pere outside Vezelay. A lovely auberge with a delightful couple, offering some sensational cooking too.
reviews.title: Restful Country Inn

description: As a starting point of the beautiful places you will see during your trip… Spend a charming family time or with your friends in this authentic house on Santiago de Compostela road near Vezelay city.
